*

Geomorphological Fun

Mar 31, 2011

The crude robot balanced tenuously on the bone above the red soil. “Why even make dinosaurs on Mars?” asked Bernie “They’ll just fail like they did the last time.” The dinosaurs escape! Flash! Zoom! Through the deeps of space they fly! But alack! Their flight is not without travail, for they are being trailed by a couple of ice asteroids. They close in on the reptiles now and all appears to be lost. They will return them to martian lands. The dinosaurs will never leave again! “Wuh? Uh-oh!” says an asteroid as he sees the dinosaurs’ intended destination. He quickly turns around, followed by the others. The dinosaurs are free! And they crash land into the translucent planet, causing it to spin round and round. How silly! What’s this? The misfit asteroid, arriving much later than the others, slams into the planet with a goofy grin on his face. Within seconds, the entire sphere is turned icy cold (the dinosaurs shiver), then very hot (dinosaurs in sunglasses at the pool) and finally, somewhere in between. Everyone smiles with arms wrapped around each others shoulders, the misfit asteroid at the center of it all.
